Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found not credible due to inconsistencies and lack of corroboration
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, submitted documents deemed insufficient or unreliable
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to credibility findings
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to seek asylum during two-year stay in the U.S.
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide independent corroborating evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Documents provided post-hearing given low weight
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of review is reasonableness for credibility
Crimes.Application_Factor: Delay in seeking asylum undermines subjective fear
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board’s decision was reasonable
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 96, 97 – definition of Convention refugee and persons in need of protection
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence and failure to seek asylum promptly
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Board provided adequate reasoning and opportunity to respond
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation in border or supporting documents
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony and implausible explanations
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged reasonableness of Board's decision
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, case law on credibility and burden of proof
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to apply for asylum in safe third country

Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish well-founded fear
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies and delay in claiming asylum
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for credibility; correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Consideration of evidence submitted after hearing
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution in Turkey and conscientious objection to military service
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to lack of credibility
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board followed fair process in evaluating evidence
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Oral testimony, documentary evidence, timing of asylum request
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Board’s credibility findings and use of evidence
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Certification of question and overturning of decision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Credibility concerns and failure to act promptly

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility and timeliness of asylum claim
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee protection decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Subjective fear undermined by delay in seeking asylum
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, documents submitted with claim
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Two-and-a-half-year stay in U.S. without seeking asylum
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to seek protection in a safe third country
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Submitted documents given little weight due to lack of verification
Crimes.Application_Factor: Delay in claiming asylum affects credibility
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board’s adverse credibility finding was reasonable
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 96 – definition of Convention refugee
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to seek asylum promptly and lack of corroborating evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Board provided transparent and intelligible reasons
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not directly alleged, but misrepresentation inferred from omissions
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Implausibility of fear given prolonged stay in U.S.
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant argued fear was genuine despite delay
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to apply for asylum during extended stay abroad
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation through omission and lack of credibility
